DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to compare oxygen desaturation during two tests: the 6 minute walk test and the 3 minute step test, for COPD patients.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of 3-Minute Step Test (3MStepT) and 6-Minute Walk Test (6MWT) in COPD Patients
DOC.detailed_description: The 6 minute walk test (6MWT) is the best field test to determine oxygen desaturation during effort, in COPD patients. However, the test need a 30m corridor. The 3 minute step test (3MST) is a other field test used in COPD patients. But no study shows that 3MST can be used to determine oxygen desaturation. The aim of this study is to compare oxygen desaturation during these to tests : the 6MWT and the 3MST. 50 patients will be included in this study. Patients realize two 6MWT and two 3MST, with rest between each test. Oxygen saturation, heart rate are registered during the tests, dyspnea, leg peniblility are notified before and after each test, distance or number of steps are noted.
DOC.criteria: stable COPD patients hospitalized for pulmonary rehabilitation program acute exacerbation of COPD incapacity to realize the tests absence of written informed consent
